title: Check Date Period
description:
PERIOD ignores the
years in the dates D1, D2 and DX. The test is performed only for months
and days, so this function works for each year. The test period can also afï¿¾ter 31 Extend beyond December, so for example from 9/1 - 3/15, a typical
application is to determine whether there is a heating period. That PERIOD
work properly the two dates D1 and D2 may not be in a leap year. It can,
for example, always be 2001, or even any other year that is not a leap
year.
PERIOD (10/1/2001, 11/11/2007, 31/03/2001) returns TRUE, because the
test date within the period from 10/1 - 3/31 content.
name: PERIOD

input.name: d1
input.description: The start date of the period.

input.name: dx
input.description: The date to check if it falls within the period.

input.name: d2
input.description: The end date of the period.

output.name: PERIOD
output.description: A boolean value indicating if the date dx is within the period defined by d1 and d2.

return_value.description: The result of whether dx is within the period between d1 and d2.
